alert.note: Alert for Anderson; Knox; Union (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 05 at 1:53PM CDT until June 05 at 2:15PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM EDT FOR NORTH CENTRAL KNOX...NORTHEASTERN ANDERSON AND SOUTHWESTERN UNION COUNTIES... At 253 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 8 miles west of Plainview, or 8 miles southwest of Maynardville, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Clinton, Plainview, Norris, Andersonville, Paulette, Big Ridge State Park and Norris Dam State Park. This includes Interstate 75 in Tennessee between mile markers 113 and 126. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare immediately for large hail and deadly cloud to ground lightning. Seek shelter inside a well-built structure. Stay away from windows. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
